message.content: {"id": "18163", "title": "Bug 18163: Add Import should ignore leading/trailing whitespace", "description": "When using the shortcut 'Shift + Ctrl + Right' to make a selection, the 'Add Import' feature should ignore any leading or trailing whitespace within the selection. Currently, when using 'Ctrl+M' to add an import, nothing happens if there is trailing whitespace within the selection. This issue needs to be fixed.", "OB": "", "EB": "When making a selection using 'Shift + Ctrl + Right' and then using 'Ctrl+M' to add an import, the 'Node' keyword is displayed as 'Node ' (with a trailing whitespace).", "SR": "The 'Add Import' feature should consistently ignore any leading or trailing whitespace within the selected text when using 'Ctrl+M'."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '18163', 'title': 'Bug 18163Add Import should ignore leading/trailing whitespace', 'description': 'Bug 18163Add Import should ignore leading/trailing whitespace ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '"Node " instead of "Node"because I made my selection by using "Shift + Ctrl + Right". ', 'SR': 'It often happens to me that I have selected i.e. When I then useCtrl+M (Add Import) nothing happens because of the trailing whitespace withinthe selection. '}
